** Masks
*** Convert all masks to JPG in RGB mode

Masks should be in the JPEG file format using a 24bit depth (24bit RGB
without alpha). Since the masks that have been provided are in the BMP
file format in grayscale (8bit only), we need to convert them. This
procedure is done only once since we are saving the JPEG masks in this
repository.

#+name: mask_bmp2jpg
#+begin_src shell :results output
for mask in $(find data/d0/f675a1-3705-49d1-9c00-576025f3142f | grep bmp$) $(find data/70/a49c79-ab5d-43f4-99d8-5b9d609da83b | grep bmp$);
do
    FILE=$(basename $mask)
    DIR=$(dirname $mask)
    pushd $DIR
    convert $FILE -type TrueColor $(basename $FILE .bmp).jpg
    popd
done
#+end_src

*** Convert all masks to 1280 x 960

Masks should have the same dimensions as the pictures in the dataset.

This procedure has already been executed, results have been committed.

#+header: dep0=mask_bmp2jpg
#+begin_src shell :results output
for mask in $(find data/d0/f675a1-3705-49d1-9c00-576025f3142f | grep jpg$ | grep -v "\-2") $(find data/70/a49c79-ab5d-43f4-99d8-5b9d609da83b | grep jpg$ | grep -v "\-2");
do
    FILE=$(basename $mask)
    DIR=$(dirname $mask)
    echo $mask
    jpeginfo $mask
    pushd $DIR
    convert $FILE -resize 1280x960 -type TrueColor $(basename $FILE .jpg)-2.jpg
    mv $(basename $FILE .jpg)-2.jpg $FILE
    popd
done
#+end_src

*** Masks description in a tibble

Reading masks into a data.frame. Since this is still experimental, I
will apply a single mask to make the process faster.
#+name: masks
#+begin_src R :results output :session :exports both
suppressMessages(library(tidyverse))
options(crayon.enabled = FALSE)
df.masks <- tibble(Mask.Filename=list.files("data/70", recursive=TRUE, pattern="jpg", full.names=TRUE)) %>%
separate(Mask.Filename, sep="/", into=c("A", "B", "C", "Mask"), remove=FALSE) %>%
    mutate(Mask = gsub(".jpg", "", Mask)) %>%
    mutate(Mask = gsub("-", "_", Mask)) %>%
    select(-A, -B, -C)
df.masks
#+end_src

To make it faster, I'll plot images from 10AM relative to a single
year. The 10AM pictures can be identified when the sequence number
equals to one. I will not consider other pictures of the same day, for
now. By doing so, we reduce our dataset for 122 pictures.

#+begin_src R :results output :session :exports both
df.peg <- df.peg %>% 
  mutate(Separator = Picture) %>%
  separate(Separator, sep='_', into=c('Year', 'Day', 'Hour', 'Sequence')) %>%
  mutate(Sequence = as.numeric(Sequence)) %>%
  mutate(Hour = as.numeric(Hour)) %>%
  filter(Sequence == 1) %>%
  filter(Hour == 10) %>%
  select(Picture.Filename, Picture)
df.peg
#+END_SRC

** Overview
*** HSV with double histogram
**** Calculate the histogram for selected pictures and mask       :ATTACH:
:PROPERTIES:
:ID:       866db30a-fff8-47ef-85bc-fc71e13dc71a
:Attachments: PEG_2014_gcc.csv.gz
:END:

#+begin_src R :results output :session :exports both
options(crayon.enabled = FALSE)
suppressMessages(library(tidyverse))
suppressMessages(library(phenovisr))

gethist <- function(df, vGrain=10)
{
    mask <- df %>% slice(1) %>% pull(Mask.Filename);
    phenovis_read_mask(mask);
    phenovis_get_HSV_double_histogram(phenovis_H(), df %>% pull(Picture.Filename), vGrain) %>%
        as_tibble()
}

df.histograms <- df.masks %>%
    mutate(dummy=TRUE) %>%
    group_by(Mask) %>%
    left_join(df.peg %>% mutate(dummy=TRUE), by=c("dummy")) %>% 
    select(-dummy) %>%
    do(gethist(.)) %>%
    ungroup()

df.histograms
#+end_src

#+name: read_peg_data
#+begin_src R :results output :session :exports both
suppressMessages(library(tidyverse));
df <- df.histograms %>%
  gather(variable, value, -Mask, -Name, -Width, -Height, -Pixels, -H, -Count) %>%
  mutate(variable = as.integer(substr(as.character(variable), 2, 100))) %>%
  mutate(variable = variable*360 + H) %>%
  separate(Name, sep="/", into=c("Dir", "Year", "Filename")) %>%
  select(-Dir, -Year) %>%
  separate(Filename, sep="_", into=c("Year", "Day", "Hour", "Sequence"), convert=TRUE) %>%
  mutate(Sequence = gsub(".jpg", "", Sequence))
df;
#+end_src

***** Overview

Finally, let's plot this thing. Even though most os the filters are
redundant (like sequence == 1 and hour between 8 and 17), I'll keep
them here for when I add more pictures.

#+header: :var dep0=peg_palette
#+begin_src R :results output graphics :file img/PEG_2014_small-v2.png :exports both :width 1400 :height 1000 :session
library(ggplot2);
df %>% 
  # This is not necessary for HSV
  #filter(variable >= lowLimit, variable < highLimit) %>%
  filter(value != 0) %>%
  filter(Hour >= 8, Hour <= 17) %>%
  filter(Sequence == 1) %>%
  group_by(Mask) %>%
  mutate(value = (value/Count)) %>%
  ungroup() %>%
  ggplot(aes(x = Day, y = value, fill=as.factor(variable))) +
  geom_bar(stat='identity', width=1) +
  ylim(0,NA) +
  theme_bw (base_size=16) +
  xlab("Day of the Year (2014)") +
  ylab("Normalized size of bins") +
  scale_fill_manual(values=palette$Color) +
  theme(#axis.ticks = element_blank(),
    #axis.text = element_blank(),
    plot.margin = unit(c(0,0,0,0), "cm"),
    legend.spacing = unit(1, "mm"),
    panel.grid = element_blank(),
    legend.position = "top",
    legend.justification = "left",
    legend.box.spacing = unit(0, "pt"),
    legend.box.margin = margin(0,0,0,0),
    legend.title = element_blank()) +
  guides(fill = guide_legend(nrow = 1)) +
  facet_grid(Hour~Mask, scales="free")
#+end_src



Okay, it's a big mess. I probably messed up the sequencing, as the
plots are showing very few days of the year... I'll migrate this to
Rstudio for now, as I think it is faster to develop there.

*** HSV with single, non static V
As discussed with Lucas, we will try to plot a single histogram (as
previous implementations already did). 

Instead of fixing the V value to 1, however, we will be sampling the V
values (using the double histogram method) and assigning the mode of V
to the whole data set.

Let's start by loading the necessary packages into our session and doing a little bit of setup...
#+BEGIN_SRC R :session analysis2
library(tidyverse)
library(colorspace)
library(phenovisr)
options(crayon.enabled = FALSE)
#+END_SRC

#+RESULTS:

Now, let's read the mask we will be using into a tibble.
#+BEGIN_SRC R :session analysis2 :results output
df.masks <- tibble(Mask.Filename = list.files('data/70', 
  recursive = TRUE, 
  pattern = 'jpg', 
  full.names = TRUE)) %>%
    separate(Mask.Filename, sep = '/', into = c('A', 'B', 'C', 'Mask'), remove = FALSE) %>%
    mutate(Mask = gsub('.jpg', '', Mask)) %>%
    mutate(Mask = gsub('-', '_', Mask)) %>%
    select(-A, -B, -C)
    df.masks
#+END_SRC

#+RESULTS:
: # A tibble: 1 x 2
:   Mask.Filename                                                 Mask          
:   <chr>                                                         <chr>         
: 1 data/70/a49c79-ab5d-43f4-99d8-5b9d609da83b/Comunidade-PEG.jpg Comunidade_PEG

Then, let's read the description of the images into another tibble
#+BEGIN_SRC R :session analysis2 :results output
df.peg <- tibble(Picture.Filename = 
  list.files('Output_PEG', pattern = 'jpg', recursive = TRUE, full.names = TRUE)) %>%
    separate(Picture.Filename, sep = '/', into = c('A', 'B', 'Picture'), remove = FALSE) %>%
    select(-A, -B) %>%
    mutate(Picture = gsub('.jpg', '', Picture))
df.peg
#+END_SRC

To make the plots faster, I'll get rid of most images and keep only
one image per day
#+BEGIN_SRC R :session analysis2 :results output
df.peg <- df.peg %>%
  separate(Picture, sep = '_', into = c('Year', 'Day', 'Hour', 'Sequence'), remove = FALSE) %>%
  mutate(Sequence = as.numeric(Sequence)) %>%
  mutate(Hour = as.numeric(Hour)) %>%
  filter(Sequence == 1) %>%
  filter(Hour == 10) %>%
  select(Picture.Filename, Picture)
df.peg
#+END_SRC

We have 122 pictures, which is relatively fast to process. Now we need
to create all possible combinations of masks and pictures.
#+BEGIN_SRC R :session analysis2 :results output
df.join <- df.masks %>%
  mutate(dummy = TRUE) %>%
  group_by(Mask) %>%
  left_join(df.peg %>% mutate(dummy = TRUE), by = 'dummy') %>%
  select(-dummy)
df.join
#+END_SRC

Okay, we are now ready to calculate the histograms for all the
pictures. Here, we define the function that will perform the
calculations and apply this funciton for all the rows in the df.join
tibble. Depending on the number of pictures, this process may take a
long time.
#+BEGIN_SRC R :session analysis2 :results output
gethist <- function(df, nsubins = 10) {
  mask <- df %>% slice(1) %>% pull(Mask.Filename)
  picture <- df %>% pull(Picture.Filename)
  phenovis_read_mask(mask)
  phenovis_get_HSV_double_histogram(phenovis_H(), picture, nsubins) %>%
    as.tibble
}

df.histograms <- df.join %>%
  do(gethist(.)) %>%
  ungroup()

df.histograms
#+END_SRC

For each row, let's get the mode of the collected V values. In case of
a tie (i.e. two bins with the same value), we'll get the last one to
get a more vibrant color.
#+BEGIN_SRC R :session analysis2 :results output
v.bins <- df.histograms %>%
  select(V0, V1, V2, V3, V4, V5, V6, V7, V8, V9)
binsMode <- colnames(v.bins)[max.col(v.bins, ties.method = 'last')]

df.histograms.mode <- df.histograms %>%
  mutate(V.Mode = max.bins)

df.histograms.mode %>% head(10) %>% as.data.frame
#+END_SRC

Now let's tidy the data. Let's also remove the bins information (V0 to
V9) because they are not relevant anymore.
#+BEGIN_SRC R :session analysis2 :results output
df.histograms.mode.tidy <- df.histograms.mode %>%
  select(-V0, -V1, -V2, -V3, -V4, -V5, -V6, -V7, -V8, -V9) %>%
  mutate(V.Mode = as.integer(substr(V.Mode, 2, 100))) %>%
  mutate(value = V.Mode*360 + H) %>%
  separate(Name, sep = '/', into = c('Dir', 'Year', 'Filename')) %>%
  select(-Dir, -Year) %>%
  separate(Filename, sep = '_', into = c('Year', 'Day', 'Hour', 'Sequence'), convert = TRUE) %>%
  mutate(Sequence = gsub('.jpg', '', Sequence))

df.histograms.mode.tidy %>% head(10) %>% as.data.frame
#+END_SRC

** 2018-10-04 Organizing data manipulation procedures
<<organized-analysis>>
*** Overview

The general data manipulation procedure involves four steps:

1. Dependencies installation
2. Mask selection (which mask shall we use?)
3. Picture selection (which time frame shall we investigate?)
4. Plot with Exploratory Analysis

These are detailed below.

*** Masks
**** Convert all masks to JPG in RGB mode

Masks should be in the JPEG file format using a 24bit depth (24bit RGB
without alpha). Since the masks that have been provided are in the BMP
file format in grayscale (8bit only), we need to convert them. This
procedure is done only once since we are saving the JPEG masks in this
repository.

#+name: mask_bmp2jpg
#+begin_src shell :results output
for mask in $(find data/d0/f675a1-3705-49d1-9c00-576025f3142f | grep bmp$) $(find data/70/a49c79-ab5d-43f4-99d8-5b9d609da83b | grep bmp$);
do
    FILE=$(basename $mask)
    DIR=$(dirname $mask)
    pushd $DIR
    convert $FILE -type TrueColor $(basename $FILE .bmp).jpg
    popd
done
#+end_src

**** Convert all masks to 1280 x 960

Masks should have the same dimensions as the pictures in the dataset.

This procedure has already been executed, results have been committed.

#+header: dep0=mask_bmp2jpg
#+begin_src shell :results output
for mask in $(find data/d0/f675a1-3705-49d1-9c00-576025f3142f | grep jpg$ | grep -v "\-2") $(find data/70/a49c79-ab5d-43f4-99d8-5b9d609da83b | grep jpg$ | grep -v "\-2");
do
    FILE=$(basename $mask)
    DIR=$(dirname $mask)
    echo $mask
    jpeginfo $mask
    pushd $DIR
    convert $FILE -resize 1280x960 -type TrueColor $(basename $FILE .jpg)-2.jpg
    mv $(basename $FILE .jpg)-2.jpg $FILE
    popd
done
#+end_src

*** Analysis
**** Introduction

Previously [1] we have calculated histograms of a vegetation index
that considers the green intensity of pixels, calculated as G/(R+G+B),
so based in RGB colors.

[1]: https://dl.acm.org/citation.cfm?id=3005917

Our new viz technique will now consider the HSV color space. So, for a
given picture, we calculate the histogram of H (with 360 bins) and,
for each H, the histogram of V (with 10 bins by default). So, since
our images are 1280\times960 pixels (total pixels is 1228800) we reduce the
amount of information from that number of pixels to 3600 bins (360 H \times
10 V). Then, there are two analysis approaches:

1. We define a color for every single possibility of H out of 360. The
   S and V components are fixed. This implies a change of the color
   observed in the picture.
   - X is day, Y is H.count, color is H
   - geom bar to stack the H.count is used

2. We define a color for every single possibility out of those 3600
   bins (360 H \times 10 V). The color definition is straightforward, since
   we have H and V (considering S as constant value).
   - X is day, Y is V.count, color is H+V
   - geom bar to stack the V.count is used

3. We define a color for each H value, and a constant S value. Instead
   of choosing any V value (constant, mean), we instead choose the one
   that is capable to represent best the corresponding H value. This
   means that from the 10 possible values, we select the one that is
   most frequent. So, at the end, we have 360 colors.
   - identical to #1, but color is based on H+V for the most frequent
     V of each H

A color coding is necessary since we are handling colors manually.
- We first define a tibble with all possible HSV combinations
- Then we define a list with the color mapping (code \to color)
  - This shall be used to color the ggplot object

Next sections show an example for each strategy.

**** Calculate the double histogram and tidy the data

The same histogram is used for both strategies. Note that while H
histogram (columns H and H.count) is already tidy, V data is spreaded,
we should gather it in two columns (V, V.count) as done below.

#+begin_src R :results output :session :exports both
options(crayon.enabled = FALSE)
suppressMessages(library(tidyverse))
suppressMessages(library(phenovisr))

gethist <- function(df, vGrain=10)
{
    mask <- df %>% slice(1) %>% pull(Mask.Filename);
    phenovis_read_mask(mask);
    phenovis_get_HSV_double_histogram(phenovis_H(), df %>% pull(Picture.Filename), vGrain) %>%
        filter(H != 0) %>%
        as_tibble()
}

df.histograms <- df.masks %>%
    mutate(dummy=TRUE) %>%
    group_by(Mask) %>%
    left_join(df.peg %>% mutate(dummy=TRUE), by=c("dummy")) %>% 
    select(-dummy) %>%
    do(gethist(.)) %>%
    ungroup() %>%
    rename(H.count = Count) %>%
    # V histogram is spread, let's gather it
    gather(V, V.count, -Mask, -Name, -Width, -Height, -Pixels, -H, -H.count) %>%
    # Remove the V, convert to integer
    mutate(V = as.integer(gsub("V", "", V))) %>%
    # Map to [0,1], convert to double
    mutate(V = as.numeric(round(V/9, 2))) %>%
    # Cosmetics
    separate(Name, sep="/", into=c("Dir", "Year", "Filename")) %>%
    select(-Dir, -Year) %>%
    separate(Filename, sep="_", into=c("Year", "Day", "Hour", "Seq"), convert=TRUE) %>%
    mutate(Seq = as.integer(gsub(".jpg", "", Seq)))
df.histograms
#+end_src

**** Strategy #1: 360 bins (360 H and a fixed S=1, V=1) CPM-like
***** H(fixed S)(fixed V) Color Palette

In this color coding, S and V are fixed to 1.

#+begin_src R :results output :session :exports both
suppressMessages(library(colorspace))
palette <- expand.grid(
    H = seq(0, 359),
    S = 1,
    V = 1) %>%
    # The color code
    mutate(Color.Code = as.factor(H)) %>%
    # The color itself
    mutate(Color = hex(HSV(H, S, V))) %>%
    as_tibble %>%
    print

palette.list <- as.character(palette$Color)
names(palette.list) <- palette$Color.Code

**** Strategy #3: (360 H, fixed S=1, but V is the mode)
***** H(fixed S)V Color Palette

In this color coding, only S is fixed to 1.

The color code is still based on H+V, as in the strategy #2.

#+begin_src R :results output :session :exports both
suppressMessages(library(colorspace))
palette <- expand.grid(
    H = seq(0, 359),
    S = 1,
    V = seq(0, 9)/10) %>%
    # The color code
    mutate(Color.Code = as.integer((H+V)*10)) %>%
    # The color itself
    mutate(Color = hex(HSV(H, S, V))) %>%
    as_tibble %>%
    print

palette.list <- as.character(palette$Color)
names(palette.list) <- palette$Color.Code
#+end_src

***** Data Manipulation (+ Confirm we have tidy data of H and V)

#+begin_src R :results output :session :exports both
st3.df <- df.histograms %>%
    group_by(Mask, Year, Day, Hour, Seq, Width, Height, Pixels, H) %>%
    # Compute the maximum V.count (the mode)
    mutate(V.max.count = max(V.count)) %>%
    # Get only that maximum among other Vs
    filter(V.count == V.max.count) %>%
    # Get rid of the computed value
    select(-V.max.count) %>%
    ungroup() %>%
    print
#+end_src

** 2018-10-09 Meeting with Comba
We discussed the results and strategies obtained so far (PEG dataset
with HSV color palette). Comba pointed out that Roger's past work
already did some exploration with strategy 1 (360 bins for H, fixed S
and V) and that the results we obtained are different for the same
dataset.

Comba's first suggestion is for me to revise the algorithm that
obtains the histogram values in order to make it match the previous
work. For clarification, here is a comparison of the analysis obtained
by Roger and our results so far:
 - Roger's results, [[file:img/roger-gcc-hcc-hist][here]] (extracted from his thesis).
 - Our results, [[file:img/peg_2014-122-st1-v3][here]].

As the images indicate, there is a clear pattern to be observed in
Roger's analysis that is ansent in our approach. We need to understand
why that is the case in order to move forward.

*** Alles' comment
Now that I think of it, the results may be different because of the
way HSV values are obtained. Roger obtained the HSV plot by changing
the color palette, but the metric used to calculate the histograms is
still the /gcc/.

Our approach, on the other hand, removes the /gcc/ completely,
obtaining the HSV value directly from the pictures.

*I am not quite sure that this difference is the complete
explanation. I'll check Lucas' opinion on this.*

** 2018-10-12 Converting image to HSV palette
<<image-to-hsv>>
From our tests on the JPEG reading and masking, we could not find any
bugs that indicate incorrect reading of the image. The next step is to
convert the original image to an HSV counterpart, to try and figure
out why there is so little green in the histograms when we use the HSV
plot.

In order to do that, I developed a python script that calculates the
HSV components for a given image, then creates a new image with only
the H value (keeping S and V fixed in 1). The colors in this image are
equivalent to those plotted in HSV's strategy 1, so we should see a
color distribution that is similar to the one presented by the
histograms.

Let's execute the script.
*** Load directory
The python script is located in the /hsv-picture/ directory.
#+BEGIN_SRC shell :session hsv-pic :results output
cd hsv-picture
ls
#+END_SRC

*** Conclusion
The relevant part of the image (excluding the red borders, tower, etc)
show that the majority of the pixels are indeed painted with a yellow

that is shown in the phenology analysis and further confirms that it

Now, let's calculate the histograms for each picture and tidy the data according to Lucas' procedure
#+BEGIN_SRC R :session pen-2017 :results output
gethist <- function(df, vGrain=10) {
    mask <- df %>% slice(1) %>% pull(Mask.Filename);
    phenovis_read_mask(mask);
    phenovis_get_HSV_double_histogram(phenovis_H(), df %>% pull(Picture.Filename), vGrain) %>%
        filter(H != 0) %>%
        as_tibble()
}

df.histograms <- df.pen.masks %>%
    gethist %>%
    rename(H.count = Count) %>%
    gather(V, V.count, -Name, -Width, -Height, -Pixels, -H, -H.count) %>%
    mutate(V = as.integer(gsub('V', '', V))) %>%
    mutate(V = as.numeric(round(V/9, 2))) %>%
    separate(Name, sep='/', into=c('A', 'B', 'C', 'D', 'Filename')) %>%
    select(-A, -B, -C, -D) %>%
    separate(Filename, sep='_', into=c('dc', 'Year', 'Day', 'Time', 'Name')) %>%
    select(-dc, -Name) %>%
    mutate(Time = gsub('\\+.*', '', Time))
df.histograms
#+END_SRC

*** Year of 2017, pictures at noon
* Extending the double histogram
** Motivation
From previous conversations with Comba and Lucas, we concluded that
the histogram calculations for the =phenovisr= package are
correct. However, the resulting histogram does not appear to be quite
accurate in the color shades it displays. From the experiment in which
I [[image-to-hsv][converted an image to the hsv hue]], I conlcuded that what might be
missing for the histogram to be more representative of the picture is
some information on the saturation (S) component from the HSV
palette. This is what I will experiment with now.
** Double histogram revisited
Right now the =phenovisr= package exports a function to calculate a
double histogram. This double histogram is organized as such:

 - There are 360 bins, one for each H value in the HSV palette. For
   simplicity, I will call these Hbins;
 - Each Hbin unit contains 10 other bins (which I will call Vbins),
   which contains the distribution of the V value for the respective H
   given by the Hbin.

The main limitation of this approach is that the S component (which
indicates saturation) is completely lost. In order to be able to plot
something with this data, then, we need to cap the saturation value to
100%. The resulting histogram is, thus, completely saturated, which
means that the plotted data does not correlate much with reality.
** Extension proposal
Right now I am leaning towards removing the double histogram
completely. My motivation for doing so is that the Vbins information
is not relevant for the end plot (the only information I use is the
mode), and adding yet another dimension for the histogram (making it a
triple histogram) would increase its complexity in a way that is not
really necessary.

The desired output for this new analysis would be a single histogram
with 360 Hbins, in which each bin contains three values: the number of
pixels contained in the bin (=HCount=), the mean value of S observed
in these pixels (=SMean=) and the mean value of V observed in these
pixels (=VMean=). The =HCount= value will be the one used to know the
height of each bin in the final CPM plot. A simplified verison of the
output provided by =phenovisr= would be a =data.frame= that looks
something like this:

| Image     | UnmaskedPixels | H | HCount | SMean | VMean |
|-----------+----------------+---+--------+-------+-------|
| image.png |         100000 | 1 |   1234 |   0.4 |   0.2 |
| image.png |         100000 | 2 |   4231 |   0.2 |   0.7 |
| image.png |         100000 | 3 |    123 |   0.1 |   0.4 |

With such an output, I will be able to plot the histogram with 360
bins (=H=), the saturation component (=SMean=) and the value
component (=VMean=).

*** Masks

#+name: masks
#+begin_src R :session hsv-new :results output :exports both

*** Analysis
**** Calculate the mean histogram and tidy the data

Now let's get the =phenovisr= package to calculate the mean histogram
with the new exported function.

#+begin_src R :session hsv-new :results output :exports both
options(crayon.enabled = FALSE)
suppressMessages(library(tidyverse))
suppressMessages(library(phenovisr))

gethist <- function(df, vGrain=10)
{
    mask <- df %>% slice(1) %>% pull(Mask.Filename);
    phenovis_read_mask(mask);
    phenovis_get_HSV_mean_histogram(df %>% pull(Picture.Filename)) %>%
        filter(H != 0) %>%
        as_tibble()
}

df.histograms <- df.masks %>%
    mutate(dummy=TRUE) %>%
    group_by(Mask) %>%
    left_join(df.peg %>% mutate(dummy=TRUE), by=c("dummy")) %>% 
    select(-dummy) %>%
    do(gethist(.)) %>%
    ungroup() %>%
    # Cosmetics
    separate(Name, sep="/", into=c("Dir", "Year", "Filename")) %>%
    select(-Dir, -Year) %>%
    separate(Filename, sep="_", into=c("Year", "Day", "Hour", "Seq"), convert=TRUE) %>%
    mutate(Seq = as.integer(gsub(".jpg", "", Seq)))
df.histograms
#+end_src

It looks like =phenovisr= is forcing =SMean= and =VMean= to be
integers. I will have to look into it later on. The rest of the output
seems to be working fine.

Okay, turns out =phenovisr= used =IntegerMatrix= and =IntegerVector=
to store the values. Changing those to =NumericMatrix= and
=NumericVector= solved the deal.

*** Plot

Let's create the color palette
#+BEGIN_SRC R :session hsv-new :results output :exports both
df.palette <- df.histograms %>%
    mutate(Color = hex(HSV(H, SMean, VMean))) %>%
    mutate(Code = as.character(Color)) %>%
    select(Color, Code)

palette.list <- as.character(df.palette$Color)
names(palette.list) <- df.palette$Code
#+END_SRC

And now let's plot the results
#+begin_src R :session hsv-new :results output graphics :file img/peg_mean_histogram.png :exports both :width 1400 :height 600
suppressMessages(library(colorspace))

df.histograms  %>%
    mutate(Color = as.character(hex(HSV(H, SMean, VMean)))) %>%
    ggplot(aes(x = Day, y = HCount, fill=as.factor(Color))) +
    scale_fill_manual(values = palette.list) +
    geom_bar(stat='identity') +
    theme_bw(base_size=16) +
    theme(axis.ticks = element_blank(),
          axis.text = element_blank(),
          plot.margin = unit(c(0,0,0,0), "cm"),
          legend.spacing = unit(0, "mm"),
          panel.grid = element_blank(),
          legend.position = "none",
          legend.justification = "left",
          legend.box.spacing = unit(0, "pt"),
          legend.box.margin = margin(0,0,0,0),
          legend.title = element_blank()) +
    guides(fill = guide_legend(nrow = 1)) +
    xlab("Day of the Year (2014)") +
    ylab("Normalized size of bins")
    #coord_flip() +
    #coord_cartesian(ylim=c(2.5e+5, 2.6e+5)) +
#+end_src

#+RESULTS:
[[file:img/peg_mean_histogram.png]]

Okay, the resulting image presents some washed-out colors instead of
the vibrant yellow/green that we observed on previous plots in which
the saturation was fixed in 100%. This set of histograms seems to
present colors that are closer to reality, but on the other hand I
cannot see any patterns that can be derived from this plot. I have two
considerations on the subject:

 1. The mean value is not a good metric to use. The results are too
    washed-out, because the saturation is pretty much the same across
    the whole set of pixels. I will modify the =phenovisr= code to
    return the mode for V and S, to check if the results are better.
 2. There /might be/ too much information in this plot. Do I really
    need to consider the various degrees of blue, cyan, magenta and
    pink (to name a few) as relevant?

** Testing HSV plot with the mode
I exported a new function from =phenovisr=:
=phenovis_get_HSV_mode_histogram=. It calculates the mode for both S
and V for each H bin, and returns the corresponding bin. Let's now use
this to try and enhance our previous mean plot.

    mutate(Code = as.character(Color)) %>%
    select(Color, Code)

palette.list <- as.character(df.palette$Color)
names(palette.list) <- df.palette$Code
#+END_SRC

#+RESULTS:

And now let's plot the results
#+begin_src R :session hsv-noon :results output graphics :file img/peg_mode_noon.png :exports both :width 1400 :height 600
df.histograms  %>%
    mutate(Color = as.character(hex(HSV(H, SMode, VMode)))) %>%
    ggplot(aes(x = Day, y = HCount, fill=as.factor(Color))) +
    scale_fill_manual(values = palette.list) +
    geom_bar(stat='identity') +
    theme_bw(base_size=16) +
    theme(axis.ticks = element_blank(),
          axis.text = element_blank(),
          plot.margin = unit(c(0,0,0,0), "cm"),
          legend.spacing = unit(0, "mm"),
          panel.grid = element_blank(),
          legend.position = "none",
          legend.justification = "left",
          legend.box.spacing = unit(0, "pt"),
          legend.box.margin = margin(0,0,0,0),
          legend.title = element_blank()) +
    guides(fill = guide_legend(nrow = 1)) +
    xlab("Day of the Year (2014)") +
    ylab("Normalized size of bins")
    #coord_flip() +

*** DONE Calculate and plot the GCC
According to Lucas' idea, I will modify the =phenovisr= package to
include the calculation of the mean =gcc= value. The objective in this
investigation is to see whether there is any actual variation on the
gcc metric, because we were not able to find any correlation so far.

For convenience, I will aggregate the image and mask manipulation, as
well as the =gcc= calculation, in the first script.
#+BEGIN_SRC R :session gcc-mean :results output :exports both
suppressMessages(library(tidyverse))
suppressMessages(library(phenovisr))
options(crayon.enabled = FALSE)
df.masks <- tibble(Mask.Filename=list.files("data/70", recursive=TRUE, pattern="jpg", full.names=TRUE)) %>%
separate(Mask.Filename, sep="/", into=c("A", "B", "C", "Mask"), remove=FALSE) %>%
    mutate(Mask = gsub(".jpg", "", Mask)) %>%
    mutate(Mask = gsub("-", "_", Mask)) %>%
    select(-A, -B, -C)

df.peg <- tibble(Picture.Filename=list.files("Output_PEG", pattern="jpg", recursive=TRUE, full.names=TRUE)) %>%
    separate(Picture.Filename, sep="/", into=c("A", "B", "Picture"), remove=FALSE) %>% select(-A, -B) %>%
    mutate(Picture = gsub(".jpg", "", Picture)) %>%
    mutate(Separator = Picture) %>%
    separate(Separator, sep='_', into=c('Year', 'Day', 'Hour', 'Sequence')) %>%
    mutate(Sequence = as.numeric(Sequence)) %>%
    mutate(Hour = as.numeric(Hour)) %>%
    filter(Sequence == 1) %>%
    filter(Hour == 10) %>%
    select(Picture.Filename, Picture)

get_mean_gcc <- function(df) {
    mask <- df %>% slice(1) %>% pull(Mask.Filename);
    phenovis_read_mask(mask);
    phenovis_get_mean_gcc(
      df %>% pull(Picture.Filename)
    ) %>% 
    as_tibble()
}

df.gcc.mean <- df.masks %>%
    mutate(dummy=TRUE) %>%
    group_by(Mask) %>%
    left_join(df.peg %>% mutate(dummy=TRUE), by=c("dummy")) %>% 
    select(-dummy) %>%
    do(get_mean_gcc(.)) %>%
    ungroup() %>%
    separate(Name, sep="/", into=c("Dir", "Year", "Filename")) %>%
    select(-Dir, -Year) %>%
    separate(Filename, sep="_", into=c("Year", "Day", "Hour", "Seq"), convert=TRUE) %>%
    mutate(Seq = as.integer(gsub(".jpg", "", Seq)))
df.gcc.mean
#+END_SRC

Now that we have the metrics, let's plot the mean gcc for every image...
#+BEGIN_SRC R :session gcc-mean :results output graphics :file img/peg_gcc_mean.png :exports both :width 700 :height 300
df.gcc.mean %>%
  ggplot(aes(x = Day, y = Mean_Gcc)) +
    geom_point() +
    geom_line() +
    xlab('Day of the year (2014)') +
    ylab('Mean gcc') +
    ylim(0.3, 0.5)
#+END_SRC

#+RESULTS:
[[file:img/peg_gcc_mean.png]]

Okay, now we know why the previous plots did not show any
results. There is pretty much no variation whatsoever on the =gcc= for
this dataset. It may be caused by the group of images that I chose or
the group of masks. By looking at the output of the [[file:small-analysis.png][small analysis]]
that I made previously, I now see that the community mask combined
with the 10AM time was not the best choice of dataset for this study
(there is just too little variation in the gcc). I will make the same
=mean_gcc= analysis for all the masks and times that I have available
in the =peg= dataset, to validate this hypothesis.

*** DONE Calculate ant plot the GCC for more samples
I will now consider all the images in the PEG dataset.

suppressMessages(library(tidyverse))
suppressMessages(library(phenovisr))

df.masks <- tibble(Mask.Filename=list.files(c("data/70", "data/d0"), recursive=TRUE, pattern="jpg", full.names=TRUE)) %>%
    separate(Mask.Filename, sep="/", into=c("A", "B", "C", "Mask"), remove=FALSE) %>%
    mutate(Mask = gsub(".jpg", "", Mask)) %>%
    mutate(Mask = gsub("-", "_", Mask)) %>%
    select(-A, -B, -C)

df.peg <- tibble(Picture.Filename=list.files("Output_PEG", pattern="jpg", recursive=TRUE, full.names=TRUE)) %>%
    separate(Picture.Filename, sep="/", into=c("A", "B", "Picture"), remove=FALSE) %>% select(-A, -B) %>%
    mutate(Picture = gsub(".jpg", "", Picture)) %>%
    mutate(Separator = Picture) %>%
    separate(Separator, sep='_', into=c('Year', 'Day', 'Hour', 'Sequence')) %>%
    mutate(Sequence = as.numeric(Sequence)) %>%
    mutate(Hour = as.numeric(Hour)) %>%
    filter(Sequence == 1) %>%
    select(Picture.Filename, Picture)

df.peg.masks <- df.masks %>%
  mutate(dummy = TRUE) %>%
  left_join(df.peg %>% mutate(dummy = TRUE), by = c('dummy')) %>%
  select(-dummy)

get_mean_gcc <- function(df) {
    mask <- df %>% slice(1) %>% pull(Mask.Filename);
    phenovis_read_mask(mask);
    phenovis_get_mean_gcc(
      df %>% pull(Picture.Filename)
    ) %>% 
    as_tibble()
}

df.gcc.mean <- df.peg.masks %>%
    group_by(Mask) %>%
    do(get_mean_gcc(.)) %>%
    ungroup() %>%
    separate(Name, sep="/", into=c("Dir", "Year", "Filename")) %>%
    select(-Dir, -Year) %>%
    separate(Filename, sep="_", into=c("Year", "Day", "Hour", "Seq"), convert=TRUE) %>%
    mutate(Seq = as.integer(gsub(".jpg", "", Seq)))

laptop. Now that we have the measurements, I can plot the =gcc=
average while facet-wrapping by mask and hour

#+BEGIN_SRC R :session mean-gcc-all :results output graphics :file img/peg_gcc_mean_all.png :exports both :width 2800 :height 1200
df.gcc.mean %>%
  ggplot(aes(x = Day, y = Mean_Gcc)) +
    geom_point() +
    geom_line() +
    xlab('Day of the year (2014)') +
    ylab('Mean gcc') +
    ylim(0.3, 0.5) +
    facet_grid(Hour~Mask, scales='free')
#+END_SRC

#+RESULTS:
[[file:img/peg_gcc_mean_all.png]]

These plots show that the PEG dataset does not have much variation on
the =gcc=, which indicates why I wasn't being able to identify any
patterns in the previous experiments (using HSV). There are, however,
some few facets that show some =gcc= variation, such as those from 6AM
and some from 13PM. I will try to plot the CPMs for these facets next.

* STARTED Full analysis
After tinkering with the =gcc= mean and thinking aboutn the problem of
not finding any patterns, I realized that I am just analyzing a small
subset of the complete PEG dataset. I will try to run the analysis
with the complete dataset, just to see if things change.

#+begin_src R :session full-analysis :results output :exports both
suppressMessages(library(tidyverse));
suppressMessages(library(phenovisr));

gethist <- function(df, vGrain=10) {
    mask <- df %>% slice(1) %>% pull(Mask.Filename);
    phenovis_read_mask(mask);
    phenovis_get_HSV_mode_histogram(df %>% pull(Picture.Filename)) %>%
        filter(H != 0) %>%
        as_tibble()
}

p <- proc.time();
df.masks %>%
    mutate(dummy=TRUE) %>%
    group_by(Mask) %>%
    left_join(df.peg %>% mutate(dummy=TRUE), by=c("dummy")) %>%   
    select(-dummy) %>%
    do(gethist(.)) %>%
    ungroup() -> df.temp;
proc.time() - p

* Histograms with mean =gcc=
Comba suggested for me to try to plot a CPM using the original =gcc=
separation (in pre defined beans), but changing the color palette:
from his suggestion, I could define the color for each =gcc= bin as
/the average color for all the pixels that fell into that =gcc= bin/.

In order to do this, I will have to modify the =phenovisr= package to
return not only the histogram for every image, but also a list of
colors that will be used in each bin.

After modifying =phenovisr=, I can call the new
=phenovis_get_gcc_color_histogram= function.

#+BEGIN_SRC R :session gcc-analysis :results output :exports both
suppressMessages(library(tidyverse))
suppressMessages(library(phenovisr))
suppressMessages(library(colorspace))

options(crayon.enabled = FALSE)

df.masks <- tibble(Mask.Filename=list.files(c("data/70"), recursive=TRUE, pattern="jpg", full.names=TRUE)) %>%
    separate(Mask.Filename, sep="/", into=c("A", "B", "C", "Mask"), remove=FALSE) %>%
    mutate(Mask = gsub(".jpg", "", Mask)) %>%
    mutate(Mask = gsub("-", "_", Mask)) %>%
    select(-A, -B, -C)

df.peg <- tibble(Picture.Filename=list.files("Output_PEG", pattern="jpg", recursive=TRUE, full.names=TRUE)) %>%
    separate(Picture.Filename, sep="/", into=c("A", "B", "Picture"), remove=FALSE) %>% select(-A, -B) %>%
    mutate(Picture = gsub(".jpg", "", Picture)) %>% 
    mutate(Separator = Picture) %>%
    separate(Separator, sep='_', into=c('Year', 'Day', 'Hour', 'Sequence')) %>%
    mutate(Sequence = as.numeric(Sequence)) %>%
    mutate(Hour = as.numeric(Hour)) %>%
    filter(Sequence == 1) %>%
    filter(Hour == 13) %>%
    select(Picture.Filename, Picture)

gethist <- function(df, grain=100) {
    mask <- df %>% slice(1) %>% pull(Mask.Filename);
    phenovis_read_mask(mask);
    phenovis_get_gcc_color_histogram(df %>% pull(Picture.Filename), grain) %>%
        as_tibble()
}

df.histograms <- df.masks %>%
    mutate(dummy=TRUE) %>%
    group_by(Mask) %>%
    left_join(df.peg %>% mutate(dummy=TRUE), by=c("dummy")) %>% 
    select(-dummy) %>%
    do(gethist(.)) %>%
    ungroup() %>%
    # Cosmetics
    separate(Name, sep="/", into=c("Dir", "Year", "Filename")) %>%
    select(-Dir, -Year) %>%
    separate(Filename, sep="_", into=c("Year", "Day", "Hour", "Seq"), convert=TRUE) %>%
    mutate(Seq = as.integer(gsub(".jpg", "", Seq)))
df.histograms
#+END_SRC

* Analysis of the TKY dataset
** Year 2003
*** Session startup
Before we do anything, let's start by setting up the R session

#+BEGIN_SRC R :session tky
suppressMessages(library(tidyverse))
suppressMessages(library(colorspace))
suppressMessages(library(phenovisr))
options(crayon.enabled = FALSE)
#+END_SRC

#+RESULTS:

*** Dataset overview
To get started with this dataset, let's take a look at the data that
is available.

#+BEGIN_SRC R :session tky :results output :exports both
df.images <- tibble(Picture.Filename=list.files(c("PEN/TKY"), recursive=TRUE, pattern="jpg", full.names=TRUE)) %>%
  separate(Picture.Filename, sep='/', into=c('Dir', 'Subdir', 'Filename'), remove=FALSE) %>%
  select(-Dir, -Subdir) %>%
  mutate(Filename = gsub('.jpg', '', Filename)) %>%
  mutate(Filename = gsub('dc_', '', Filename)) %>%
  separate(Filename, sep='__', into=c('Filename', 'Camera_ID')) %>%
  separate(Filename, sep='_', into=c('Year', 'Day', 'Time', 'Dataset')) %>%
  mutate(Time = gsub('\\+.*', '', Time)) %>%
  mutate(Hour = as.integer(substr(Time, 1, 2))) %>%
  mutate(Minute = as.integer(substr(Time, 3, 4))) %>%
  mutate(Year = as.integer(Year)) %>%

*** Masks
Let's read the mask into a dataframe. By inspecting the available
masks manually, I eyeballed that there are no masks that fit in a very satisfiable way. I created my own mask, which is the one I will be using.

#+BEGIN_SRC R :session tky :results output :exports both
df.masks <- tibble(Mask.Filename=list.files("masks", recursive=TRUE, pattern="jpg", full.names=TRUE)) %>%
    filter(Mask.Filename == 'masks/alles-tky-y18_d-mask.jpg') %>%
    separate(Mask.Filename, sep="/", into=c("Directory", "Mask"), remove=FALSE) %>%
    mutate(Mask = gsub(".jpg", "", Mask)) %>%
    mutate(Mask = gsub("-", "_", Mask)) %>%
    select(-Directory)
df.masks

Let's now join the masks and pictures for the analysis.

  group_by(Mask) %>%

  select(-dummy) %>%
  ungroup()
df.joined

Now let's merge masks and images and calculate metrics.
#+BEGIN_SRC R :session tky :results output :exports both
gethist <- function(df, grain=100) {
    mask <- df %>% slice(1) %>% pull(Mask.Filename);
    phenovis_read_mask(mask);
    phenovis_get_gcc_color_histogram(df %>% pull(Picture.Filename), grain) %>%
        as_tibble()
}

df.histograms <- df.joined %>%
  do(gethist(.)) %>%
  # Cosmetics
  separate(Name, sep='/', into=c('Dir', 'Subdir', 'Filename'), remove=FALSE) %>%
  select(-Dir, -Subdir) %>%
  mutate(Filename = gsub('.jpg', '', Filename)) %>%
  mutate(Filename = gsub('dc_', '', Filename)) %>%
  separate(Filename, sep='__', into=c('Filename', 'Camera_ID')) %>%
  separate(Filename, sep='_', into=c('Year', 'Day', 'Time', 'Dataset')) %>%
  mutate(Time = gsub('\\+.*', '', Time)) %>%
  mutate(Hour = as.integer(substr(Time, 1, 2))) %>%
  mutate(Minute = as.integer(substr(Time, 3, 4))) %>%
  mutate(Year = as.integer(Year)) %>%
  mutate(Day = as.integer(Day)) %>%
  select(-Time)
df.histograms
#+END_SRC

And now let's plot it.
#+BEGIN_SRC R :session tky :results output graphics :file img/tky-2003-11am.png :exports both :width 700 :height 400

df.palette <- df.histograms %>%
  mutate(Color = hex(RGB(Bin_color_r, Bin_color_g, Bin_color_b))) %>%
  mutate(Code = as.character(Color)) %>%
  select(Color, Code)

palette.list <- as.character(df.palette$Color)
names(palette.list) <- df.palette$Code

df.histograms  %>%
  filter(Bin_value != 0) %>%
  filter(GCC_bin >= 30) %>%
  filter(GCC_bin <= 50) %>%
  mutate(Color = as.character(hex(RGB(Bin_color_r, Bin_color_g, Bin_color_b)))) %>%
  ggplot(aes(x = Name, y = Bin_value/Pixels, fill=as.factor(Color))) +
  scale_fill_manual(values = palette.list) +
  geom_bar(stat='identity') +
  theme_bw(base_size=16) +
  theme(#axis.ticks = element_blank(),
        #axis.text = element_blank(),
        plot.margin = unit(c(0,0,0,0), "cm"),
        legend.spacing = unit(0, "mm"),
        panel.grid = element_blank(),

        legend.justification = "left",
        legend.box.spacing = unit(0, "pt"),
        legend.box.margin = margin(0,0,0,0),
        legend.title = element_blank()) +
  guides(fill = guide_legend(nrow = 1)) +
  xlab("DOY") +
  ylab("Normalized size of bins")

These results are looking neat, but unfortunately the sample size is
too small. I will compute the data from 2014 next.
** Year 2004
I discovered that the TKY dataset is divided in two sections, with
different image sizes and masks. I will thus make two separate
analysis.
*** First section
**** Session startup
Before we do anything, let's start by setting up the R session

#+BEGIN_SRC R :session tky-2004

suppressMessages(library(colorspace))
suppressMessages(library(phenovisr))
options(crayon.enabled = FALSE)
#+END_SRC

  mutate(Filename = gsub('.jpg', '', Filename)) %>%
  mutate(Filename = gsub('dc_', '', Filename)) %>%
  separate(Filename, sep='__', into=c('Filename', 'Camera_ID')) %>%
  separate(Filename, sep='_', into=c('Year', 'Day', 'Time', 'Dataset')) %>%
  mutate(Time = gsub('\\+.*', '', Time)) %>%
  mutate(Hour = as.integer(substr(Time, 1, 2))) %>%
  mutate(Minute = as.integer(substr(Time, 3, 4))) %>%
  mutate(Year = as.integer(Year)) %>%
  mutate(Day = as.integer(Day)) %>%
  select(-Time)
df.histograms
#+END_SRC

It seems like this dataset has images of different dimensions. I added
some logs in the =phenovisr= and verified that images from doy below
89 are 1600x1200 and images from doy 89 and above are 2272x1704. Let's
filter off the larger images (so that our current mask fits), then we
can calculate the remaining histograms with another mask.

#+BEGIN_SRC R :session tky-2004 :results output
gethist <- function(df, grain=100) {
    mask <- df %>% slice(1) %>% pull(Mask.Filename);
    phenovis_read_mask(mask);
    phenovis_get_gcc_color_histogram(df %>% pull(Picture.Filename), grain) %>%
        as_tibble()
}

df.histograms.part1 <- df.joined %>%
  filter(Day < 89) %>%
  do(gethist(.)) %>%
  # Cosmetics
  separate(Name, sep='/', into=c('Dir', 'Subdir', 'Filename'), remove=FALSE) %>%
  select(-Dir, -Subdir) %>%
  mutate(Filename = gsub('.jpg', '', Filename)) %>%
  mutate(Filename = gsub('dc_', '', Filename)) %>%
  separate(Filename, sep='__', into=c('Filename', 'Camera_ID')) %>%
  separate(Filename, sep='_', into=c('Year', 'Day', 'Time', 'Dataset')) %>%
  mutate(Time = gsub('\\+.*', '', Time)) %>%
  mutate(Hour = as.integer(substr(Time, 1, 2))) %>%
  mutate(Minute = as.integer(substr(Time, 3, 4))) %>%
  mutate(Year = as.integer(Year)) %>%
  mutate(Day = as.integer(Day)) %>%
  select(-Time)
df.histograms.part1
#+END_SRC

And now let's plot it.
#+BEGIN_SRC R :session tky-2004 :results output graphics :file img/tky-2004-part-1.png :exports both :width 700 :height 400

df.palette <- df.histograms.part1 %>%
  mutate(Color = hex(RGB(Bin_color_r, Bin_color_g, Bin_color_b))) %>%
  mutate(Code = as.character(Color)) %>%
  select(Color, Code)

palette.list <- as.character(df.palette$Color)
names(palette.list) <- df.palette$Code

df.histograms.part1  %>%
  filter(Bin_value != 0) %>%
  filter(GCC_bin >= 30) %>%
  filter(GCC_bin <= 50) %>%
  mutate(Color = as.character(hex(RGB(Bin_color_r, Bin_color_g, Bin_color_b)))) %>%
  ggplot(aes(x = Name, y = Bin_value/Pixels, fill=as.factor(Color))) +
  scale_fill_manual(values = palette.list) +
  geom_bar(stat='identity') +
  theme_bw(base_size=16) +
  theme(#axis.ticks = element_blank(),
        #axis.text = element_blank(),
        plot.margin = unit(c(0,0,0,0), "cm"),
        legend.spacing = unit(0, "mm"),
        panel.grid = element_blank(),
        legend.position = "none",
        legend.justification = "left",
        legend.box.spacing = unit(0, "pt"),
        legend.box.margin = margin(0,0,0,0),
        legend.title = element_blank()) +
  guides(fill = guide_legend(nrow = 1)) +
  xlab("DOY") +
  ylab("Normalized size of bins")
#+END_SRC

**** Dataset overview
To get started with this dataset, let's take a look at the data that
is available. Since the number of images on this dataset is quite
large, I will analyze it from my external hard drive.

#+BEGIN_SRC R :session tky-2004-2 :results output :exports both
df.images <- tibble(Picture.Filename=list.files(c("PEN/TKY-2004"), recursive=TRUE, pattern="jpg", full.names=TRUE)) %>%
  separate(Picture.Filename, sep='/', into=c('Dir', 'Subdir', 'Filename'), remove=FALSE) %>%
  select(-Dir, -Subdir) %>%
  mutate(Filename = gsub('.jpg', '', Filename)) %>%
  mutate(Filename = gsub('dc_', '', Filename)) %>%
  separate(Filename, sep='__', into=c('Filename', 'Camera_ID')) %>%
  separate(Filename, sep='_', into=c('Year', 'Day', 'Time', 'Dataset')) %>%
  mutate(Time = gsub('\\+.*', '', Time)) %>%
  mutate(Hour = as.integer(substr(Time, 1, 2))) %>%
  mutate(Minute = as.integer(substr(Time, 3, 4))) %>%
  mutate(Year = as.integer(Year)) %>%
  mutate(Day = as.integer(Day)) %>%
  select(-Time)
df.images

**** Masks
Let's read the mask into a dataframe. By inspecting the available
masks manually, I eyeballed that there are no masks that fit in a very
satisfiable way. I created my own mask, which is the one I will be
using.

#+BEGIN_SRC R :session tky-2004-2 :results output :exports both
df.masks <- tibble(Mask.Filename=list.files("masks", recursive=TRUE, pattern="jpg", full.names=TRUE)) %>%
    filter(Mask.Filename == 'masks/dc_TKY_y18_d_mask_section_1.jpg') %>%
    separate(Mask.Filename, sep="/", into=c("Directory", "Mask"), remove=FALSE) %>%
    mutate(Mask = gsub(".jpg", "", Mask)) %>%
    mutate(Mask = gsub("-", "_", Mask)) %>%
    select(-Directory)
df.masks
#+END_SRC

**** Computation and plot
Let's now join the masks and pictures for the analysis.

#+BEGIN_SRC R :session tky-2004-2 :results output :exports both
df.joined <- df.masks %>% mutate(dummy = TRUE) %>%
  group_by(Mask) %>%
  left_join(df.final %>% mutate(dummy = TRUE), by=c('dummy')) %>%
  select(-dummy) %>%
  ungroup()
df.joined
#+END_SRC

Now let's merge masks and images and calculate metrics.
#+BEGIN_SRC R :session tky-2004-2 :results output :exports both
gethist <- function(df, grain=100) {
    mask <- df %>% slice(1) %>% pull(Mask.Filename);
    phenovis_read_mask(mask);
    phenovis_get_gcc_color_histogram(df %>% pull(Picture.Filename), grain) %>%
        as_tibble()
}

df.histograms <- df.joined %>%
  do(gethist(.)) %>%
  # Cosmetics
  separate(Name, sep='/', into=c('Dir', 'Subdir', 'Filename'), remove=FALSE) %>%
  select(-Dir, -Subdir) %>%
  mutate(Filename = gsub('.jpg', '', Filename)) %>%
  mutate(Filename = gsub('dc_', '', Filename)) %>%
  separate(Filename, sep='__', into=c('Filename', 'Camera_ID')) %>%
  separate(Filename, sep='_', into=c('Year', 'Day', 'Time', 'Dataset')) %>%
  mutate(Time = gsub('\\+.*', '', Time)) %>%
  mutate(Hour = as.integer(substr(Time, 1, 2))) %>%
  mutate(Minute = as.integer(substr(Time, 3, 4))) %>%
  mutate(Year = as.integer(Year)) %>%
  mutate(Day = as.integer(Day)) %>%
  select(-Time)
df.histograms
#+END_SRC

And now let's plot it.
#+BEGIN_SRC R :session tky-2004-2 :results output graphics :file img/tky-2004-part-2.png :exports both :width 700 :height 400

df.palette <- df.histograms %>%
  mutate(Color = hex(RGB(Bin_color_r, Bin_color_g, Bin_color_b))) %>%
  mutate(Code = as.character(Color)) %>%
  select(Color, Code)

palette.list <- as.character(df.palette$Color)
names(palette.list) <- df.palette$Code

df.histograms  %>%
  filter(Bin_value != 0) %>%
  #filter(GCC_bin >= 30) %>%
  #filter(GCC_bin <= 50) %>%
  mutate(Color = as.character(hex(RGB(Bin_color_r, Bin_color_g, Bin_color_b)))) %>%
  ggplot(aes(x = Day, y = Bin_value/Pixels, fill=as.factor(Color))) +
  scale_fill_manual(values = palette.list) +
  geom_bar(stat='identity') +
  theme_bw(base_size=16) +
  theme(#axis.ticks = element_blank(),
        #axis.text = element_blank(),
        plot.margin = unit(c(0,0,0,0), "cm"),
        legend.spacing = unit(0, "mm"),
        panel.grid = element_blank(),
        legend.position = "none",
        legend.justification = "left",
        legend.box.spacing = unit(0, "pt"),
        legend.box.margin = margin(0,0,0,0),
        legend.title = element_blank()) +
  guides(fill = guide_legend(nrow = 1)) +
  xlab("DOY") +
  ylab("Normalized size of bins")
#+END_SRC

I see that there are some days which have two or even three pictures
for the same hour, and there are some days which have no pictures at
all. I will probably need some pre-processing to determine which
pictures to take into consideration.

Let's take a look in the hourly distribution of pictures in our sample.
#+BEGIN_SRC R :session tky-2004-2 :results output :exports both
df.images %>%
  filter(Camera_ID == 'y18_d') %>%
  group_by(Hour) %>%
  summarize(
    total = n()
  ) %>%
  ungroup()

Now we have to calculate the histograms
#+BEGIN_SRC R :session tky-2004-2 :results output :exports both
gethist <- function(df, grain=100) {
    mask <- df %>% slice(1) %>% pull(Mask.Filename);
    phenovis_read_mask(mask);
    phenovis_get_gcc_color_histogram(df %>% pull(Picture.Filename), grain) %>%
        as_tibble()
}

df.histograms <- df.joined %>%
  do(gethist(.)) %>%
  # Cosmetics
  separate(Name, sep='/', into=c('Dir', 'Subdir', 'Filename'), remove=FALSE) %>%
  select(-Dir, -Subdir) %>%
  mutate(Filename = gsub('.jpg', '', Filename)) %>%
  mutate(Filename = gsub('dc_', '', Filename)) %>%
  separate(Filename, sep='__', into=c('Filename', 'Camera_ID')) %>%
  separate(Filename, sep='_', into=c('Year', 'Day', 'Time', 'Dataset')) %>%
  mutate(Time = gsub('\\+.*', '', Time)) %>%
  mutate(Hour = as.integer(substr(Time, 1, 2))) %>%
  mutate(Minute = as.integer(substr(Time, 3, 4))) %>%
  mutate(Year = as.integer(Year)) %>%
  mutate(Day = as.integer(Day)) %>%
  select(-Time)
df.histograms
#+END_SRC

And finally plot the CPMs
#+BEGIN_SRC R :session tky-2004-2 :results output graphics :file img/tky-2004-12pm-13pm.png :exports both :width 700 :height 400

df.palette <- df.histograms %>%
  mutate(Color = hex(RGB(Bin_color_r, Bin_color_g, Bin_color_b))) %>%
  mutate(Code = as.character(Color)) %>%
  select(Color, Code)

palette.list <- as.character(df.palette$Color)
names(palette.list) <- df.palette$Code

df.histograms  %>%
  filter(Bin_value != 0) %>%
  #filter(GCC_bin >= 30) %>%
  #filter(GCC_bin <= 50) %>%
  mutate(Color = as.character(hex(RGB(Bin_color_r, Bin_color_g, Bin_color_b)))) %>%
  ggplot(aes(x = Day, y = Bin_value/Pixels, fill=as.factor(Color))) +
  scale_fill_manual(values = palette.list) +
  geom_bar(stat='identity') +
  theme_bw(base_size=16) +
  theme(#axis.ticks = element_blank(),
        #axis.text = element_blank(),
        plot.margin = unit(c(0,0,0,0), "cm"),
        legend.spacing = unit(0, "mm"),
        panel.grid = element_blank(),
        legend.position = "none",
        legend.justification = "left",
        legend.box.spacing = unit(0, "pt"),
        legend.box.margin = margin(0,0,0,0),
        legend.title = element_blank()) +
  guides(fill = guide_legend(nrow = 1)) +
  xlab("DOY") +
  ylab("Normalized size of bins")
#+END_SRC

*** Merging two sections together
I will merge the two sections together now. The idea is to use one
mask (the smaller one) for images between doy 1 and 88 and the other
mask for the remaining days. With that I expect to have a decent
overview of the year of 2004.
**** Session startup
Before we do anything, let's start by setting up the R session

#+BEGIN_SRC R :session tky-2004-full
suppressMessages(library(tidyverse))
suppressMessages(library(colorspace))
suppressMessages(library(phenovisr))
options(crayon.enabled = FALSE)
#+END_SRC

#+RESULTS:
: FALSE

**** Dataset overview
Let's read all the images into the data frame
#+BEGIN_SRC R :session tky-2004-full :results output :exports both
df.images <- tibble(Picture.Filename=list.files(c("PEN/TKY-2004"), recursive=TRUE, pattern="jpg", full.names=TRUE)) %>%
  separate(Picture.Filename, sep='/', into=c('Dir', 'Subdir', 'Filename'), remove=FALSE) %>%
  select(-Dir, -Subdir) %>%
  mutate(Filename = gsub('.jpg', '', Filename)) %>%
  mutate(Filename = gsub('dc_', '', Filename)) %>%
  separate(Filename, sep='__', into=c('Filename', 'Camera_ID')) %>%
  separate(Filename, sep='_', into=c('Year', 'Day', 'Time', 'Dataset')) %>%
  mutate(Time = gsub('\\+.*', '', Time)) %>%
  mutate(Hour = as.integer(substr(Time, 1, 2))) %>%
  mutate(Minute = as.integer(substr(Time, 3, 4))) %>%
  mutate(Year = as.integer(Year)) %>%
  mutate(Day = as.integer(Day)) %>%
  select(-Time)
df.images
#+END_SRC

**** Masks
Now I will read 2 masks, for the two separate sections. I will remove
the invalid combinations (such as doy >= 90 and smaller mask) later on.

#+BEGIN_SRC R :session tky-2004-full :results output :exports both
df.masks <- tibble(Mask.Filename=list.files("masks", recursive=TRUE, pattern="jpg", full.names=TRUE)) %>%
    filter(
      Mask.Filename == 'masks/alles-tky-y18_d-mask.jpg' | Mask.Filename == 'masks/dc_TKY_y18_d_mask_section_1.jpg'
    ) %>%
    separate(Mask.Filename, sep="/", into=c("Directory", "Mask"), remove=FALSE) %>%
    mutate(Mask = gsub(".jpg", "", Mask)) %>%
    mutate(Mask = gsub("-", "_", Mask)) %>%
    select(-Directory)
df.masks
#+END_SRC

**** Computation and plot
Let's now join the masks and pictures for the analysis.

#+BEGIN_SRC R :session tky-2004-full :results output :exports both
df.joined <- df.masks %>% mutate(dummy = TRUE) %>%
  group_by(Mask) %>%
  left_join(df.final %>% mutate(dummy = TRUE), by=c('dummy')) %>%
  select(-dummy) %>%
  ungroup()
df.joined

Now let's calculate metrics. Since the =phenovisr= mask is global, we
need to do this operation in two parts.
#+BEGIN_SRC R :session tky-2004-full :results output :exports both

gethist <- function(df, grain=100) {
    mask <- df %>% slice(1) %>% pull(Mask.Filename);
    phenovis_read_mask(mask);
    phenovis_get_gcc_color_histogram(df %>% pull(Picture.Filename), grain) %>%
        as_tibble()
}

df.histograms.part1 <- df.joined %>%
  filter(Day <= 89) %>%
  do(gethist(.))

df.histograms.part2 <- df.joined %>%
  filter(Day >= 90) %>%
  do(gethist(.))
#+END_SRC

*** Testing 2004-TKY with HSV palette
For the previous experiments with the HSV color palette, I wasn't
having much success. Later on, I discovered that it was basically
because the PEG dataset (which I was using until then) was not
actually good for visualizing patterns in color variation because the
images are too similar across all the observations.

In this section, I will revisit some analysis than I made previously
(with not much success), to check whether anything changes.

**** HSV with mean

Now let's calculate the mean histogram using =phenovisr=

#+begin_src R :session hsv-tky :results output :exports both
gethist <- function(df, vGrain=10) {
    mask <- df %>% slice(1) %>% pull(Mask.Filename);
    phenovis_read_mask(mask);
    phenovis_get_HSV_mean_histogram(df %>% pull(Picture.Filename)) %>%
        filter(H != 0) %>%
        as_tibble()
}

df.histograms.part1 <- df.joined %>%
  filter(Day <= 89) %>%
  do(gethist(.))

df.histograms.part2 <- df.joined %>%
  filter(Day >= 90) %>%
  do(gethist(.))

df.histograms <- rbind(df.histograms.part1, df.histograms.part2) %>%
  # Cosmetics
  separate(Name, sep='/', into=c('Dir', 'Subdir', 'Filename'), remove=FALSE) %>%
  select(-Dir, -Subdir) %>%
  mutate(Filename = gsub('.jpg', '', Filename)) %>%
  mutate(Filename = gsub('dc_', '', Filename)) %>%
  separate(Filename, sep='__', into=c('Filename', 'Camera_ID')) %>%
  separate(Filename, sep='_', into=c('Year', 'Day', 'Time', 'Dataset')) %>%
  mutate(Time = gsub('\\+.*', '', Time)) %>%
  mutate(Hour = as.integer(substr(Time, 1, 2))) %>%
  mutate(Minute = as.integer(substr(Time, 3, 4))) %>%
  mutate(Year = as.integer(Year)) %>%
  mutate(Day = as.integer(Day)) %>%
  select(-Time)
df.histograms

Now let's calculate the mean histogram using =phenovisr=

#+begin_src R :session hsv-mode-tky :results output :exports both
gethist <- function(df, vGrain=10) {
    mask <- df %>% slice(1) %>% pull(Mask.Filename);
    phenovis_read_mask(mask);
    phenovis_get_HSV_mode_histogram(df %>% pull(Picture.Filename)) %>%
        filter(H != 0) %>%
        as_tibble()
}

df.histograms.part1 <- df.joined %>%
  filter(Day <= 89) %>%
  do(gethist(.))

df.histograms.part2 <- df.joined %>%
  filter(Day >= 90) %>%
  do(gethist(.))

df.histograms <- rbind(df.histograms.part1, df.histograms.part2) %>%
  # Cosmetics
  separate(Name, sep='/', into=c('Dir', 'Subdir', 'Filename'), remove=FALSE) %>%
  select(-Dir, -Subdir) %>%
  mutate(Filename = gsub('.jpg', '', Filename)) %>%
  mutate(Filename = gsub('dc_', '', Filename)) %>%
  separate(Filename, sep='__', into=c('Filename', 'Camera_ID')) %>%
  separate(Filename, sep='_', into=c('Year', 'Day', 'Time', 'Dataset')) %>%
  mutate(Time = gsub('\\+.*', '', Time)) %>%

  mutate(Minute = as.integer(substr(Time, 3, 4))) %>%

#+begin_src R :session hsv-pure-tky :results output :exports both
gethist <- function(df, vGrain=10) {
    mask <- df %>% slice(1) %>% pull(Mask.Filename);
    phenovis_read_mask(mask);
    phenovis_get_HSV_double_histogram(phenovis_H(), df %>% pull(Picture.Filename), vGrain) %>%
        filter(H != 0) %>%
        as_tibble()
}

df.histograms.part1 <- df.joined %>%
  filter(Day <= 89) %>%
  do(gethist(.))

df.histograms.part2 <- df.joined %>%
  filter(Day >= 90) %>%
  do(gethist(.))

df.histograms <- rbind(df.histograms.part1, df.histograms.part2) %>%
  rename(H.count = Count) %>%
  # V histogram is spread, let's gather it
  gather(V, V.count, -Name, -Width, -Height, -Pixels, -H, -H.count) %>%
  # Remove the V, convert to integer
  mutate(V = as.integer(gsub("V", "", V))) %>%
  # Map to [0,1], convert to double
  mutate(V = as.numeric(round(V/9, 2))) %>%
  # Cosmetics
  separate(Name, sep='/', into=c('Dir', 'Subdir', 'Filename'), remove=FALSE) %>%
  select(-Dir, -Subdir) %>%
  mutate(Filename = gsub('.jpg', '', Filename)) %>%
  mutate(Filename = gsub('dc_', '', Filename)) %>%
  separate(Filename, sep='__', into=c('Filename', 'Camera_ID')) %>%
  separate(Filename, sep='_', into=c('Year', 'Day', 'Time', 'Dataset')) %>%
  mutate(Time = gsub('\\+.*', '', Time)) %>%
  mutate(Hour = as.integer(substr(Time, 1, 2))) %>%
  mutate(Minute = as.integer(substr(Time, 3, 4))) %>%
  mutate(Year = as.integer(Year)) %>%
  mutate(Day = as.integer(Day)) %>%
  select(-Time)
df.histograms
#+end_src

gethist <- function(df, vGrain=10) {
    mask <- df %>% slice(1) %>% pull(Mask.Filename);
    phenovis_read_mask(mask);
    phenovis_get_HSV_double_histogram(phenovis_H(), df %>% pull(Picture.Filename), vGrain) %>%
        filter(H != 0) %>%
        as_tibble()
}

df.histograms <- df.joined %>%
  do(gethist(.)) %>%
  rename(H.count = Count) %>%
  # V histogram is spread, let's gather it
  gather(V, V.count, -Name, -Width, -Height, -Pixels, -H, -H.count) %>%
  # Remove the V, convert to integer
  mutate(V = as.integer(gsub("V", "", V))) %>%
  # Map to [0,1], convert to double
  mutate(V = as.numeric(round(V/9, 2))) %>%
  # Cosmetics
  separate(Name, sep='/', into=c('Dir', 'Subdir', 'Filename'), remove=FALSE) %>%
  select(-Dir, -Subdir) %>%
  mutate(Filename = gsub('.jpg', '', Filename)) %>%
  mutate(Filename = gsub('dc_', '', Filename)) %>%
  separate(Filename, sep='__', into=c('Filename', 'Camera_ID')) %>%
  separate(Filename, sep='_', into=c('Year', 'Day', 'Time', 'Dataset')) %>%
  mutate(Time = gsub('\\+.*', '', Time)) %>%
  mutate(Hour = as.integer(substr(Time, 1, 2))) %>%
  mutate(Minute = as.integer(substr(Time, 3, 4))) %>%
  mutate(Year = as.integer(Year)) %>%
  mutate(Day = as.integer(Day)) %>%
  select(-Time)
df.histograms
#+end_src

gethist <- function(df, vGrain=10) {
    mask <- df %>% slice(1) %>% pull(Mask.Filename);

        filter(H != 0) %>%
        as_tibble()
}

  mutate(Minute = as.integer(substr(Time, 3, 4))) %>%
  mutate(Year = as.integer(Year)) %>%
  mutate(Day = as.integer(Day)) %>%
  select(-Time)
df.histograms

Now let's calculate metrics. 
#+BEGIN_SRC R :session tky-2005-gcc-mean :results output :exports both

gethist <- function(df, grain=100) {
    mask <- df %>% slice(1) %>% pull(Mask.Filename);
    phenovis_read_mask(mask);
    phenovis_get_gcc_color_histogram(df %>% pull(Picture.Filename), grain) %>%
        as_tibble()
}

df.histograms <- df.joined %>%
  do(gethist(.)) %>%
  # Cosmetics
  separate(Name, sep='/', into=c('Dir', 'Subdir', 'Filename'), remove=FALSE) %>%
  select(-Dir, -Subdir) %>%
  mutate(Filename = gsub('.jpg', '', Filename)) %>%
  mutate(Filename = gsub('dc_', '', Filename)) %>%
  separate(Filename, sep='__', into=c('Filename', 'Camera_ID')) %>%
  separate(Filename, sep='_', into=c('Year', 'Day', 'Time', 'Dataset')) %>%
  mutate(Time = gsub('\\+.*', '', Time)) %>%
  mutate(Hour = as.integer(substr(Time, 1, 2))) %>%
  mutate(Minute = as.integer(substr(Time, 3, 4))) %>%
  mutate(Year = as.integer(Year)) %>%
  mutate(Day = as.integer(Day)) %>%
  select(-Time)
df.histograms
#+END_SRC

And now let's plot it.
#+BEGIN_SRC R :session tky-2005-gcc-mean :results output graphics :file img/tky-2005-gcc-mean.png :exports both :width 1400 :height 800

df.palette <- df.histograms %>%
  mutate(Color = hex(RGB(Bin_color_r, Bin_color_g, Bin_color_b))) %>%
  mutate(Code = as.character(Color)) %>%
  select(Color, Code)

palette.list <- as.character(df.palette$Color)
names(palette.list) <- df.palette$Code

df.histograms  %>%
  filter(Bin_value != 0) %>%
  mutate(Color = as.character(hex(RGB(Bin_color_r, Bin_color_g, Bin_color_b)))) %>%
  ggplot(aes(x = Day, y = Bin_value/Pixels, fill=as.factor(Color))) +
  scale_fill_manual(values = palette.list) +
  geom_bar(stat='identity') +
  theme_bw(base_size=16) +
  theme(#axis.ticks = element_blank(),
        #axis.text = element_blank(),
        plot.margin = unit(c(0,0,0,0), "cm"),
        legend.spacing = unit(0, "mm"),
        panel.grid = element_blank(),
        legend.position = "none",
        legend.justification = "left",
        legend.box.spacing = unit(0, "pt"),
        legend.box.margin = margin(0,0,0,0),
        legend.title = element_blank()) +
  guides(fill = guide_legend(nrow = 1)) +
  xlab("DOY (2005)") +
  ylab("Normalized size of bins")
#+END_SRC

Now let's read the images we have into a tibble
#+BEGIN_SRC R :session tky-overview :results output :exports both
df.images <- tibble(Picture.Filename=list.files(c("PEN/tky-2006-y18_d-imported"), recursive=TRUE, pattern="jpg", full.names=TRUE)) %>%
  separate(Picture.Filename, sep='/', into=c('Dir', 'Subdir', 'Filename'), remove=FALSE) %>%
  select(-Dir, -Subdir) %>%

#+begin_src R :session tky-2006-hsv-h :results output :exports both
gethist <- function(df, vGrain=10) {
    mask <- df %>% slice(1) %>% pull(Mask.Filename);
    phenovis_read_mask(mask);
    phenovis_get_HSV_double_histogram(phenovis_H(), df %>% pull(Picture.Filename), vGrain) %>%
        filter(H != 0) %>%
        as_tibble()
}

df.histograms <- df.joined %>%
  do(gethist(.)) %>%
  rename(H.count = Count) %>%
  # V histogram is spread, let's gather it
  gather(V, V.count, -Name, -Width, -Height, -Pixels, -H, -H.count) %>%
  # Remove the V, convert to integer
  mutate(V = as.integer(gsub("V", "", V))) %>%
  # Map to [0,1], convert to double
  mutate(V = as.numeric(round(V/9, 2))) %>%
  # Cosmetics
  separate(Name, sep='/', into=c('Dir', 'Subdir', 'Filename'), remove=FALSE) %>%
  select(-Dir, -Subdir) %>%
  mutate(Filename = gsub('.jpg', '', Filename)) %>%
  mutate(Filename = gsub('dc_', '', Filename)) %>%
  separate(Filename, sep='__', into=c('Filename', 'Camera_ID')) %>%
  separate(Filename, sep='_', into=c('Year', 'Day', 'Time', 'Dataset')) %>%
  mutate(Time = gsub('\\+.*', '', Time)) %>%
  mutate(Hour = as.integer(substr(Time, 1, 2))) %>%
  mutate(Minute = as.integer(substr(Time, 3, 4))) %>%
  mutate(Year = as.integer(Year)) %>%
  mutate(Day = as.integer(Day)) %>%
  select(-Time)
df.histograms

And now let's plot it.
#+BEGIN_SRC R :session tky-2006-gcc-mean :results output graphics :file img/tky-2006-gcc-mean.png :exports both :width 1400 :height 800

df.palette <- df.histograms %>%
  mutate(Color = hex(RGB(Bin_color_r, Bin_color_g, Bin_color_b))) %>%
  mutate(Code = as.character(Color)) %>%
  select(Color, Code)

palette.list <- as.character(df.palette$Color)
names(palette.list) <- df.palette$Code

df.histograms  %>%
  filter(Bin_value != 0) %>%
  mutate(Color = as.character(hex(RGB(Bin_color_r, Bin_color_g, Bin_color_b)))) %>%
  ggplot(aes(x = Day, y = Bin_value/Pixels, fill=as.factor(Color))) +
  scale_fill_manual(values = palette.list) +
  geom_bar(stat='identity') +
  theme_bw(base_size=16) +
  theme(#axis.ticks = element_blank(),
        #axis.text = element_blank(),
        plot.margin = unit(c(0,0,0,0), "cm"),
        legend.spacing = unit(0, "mm"),
        panel.grid = element_blank(),
        legend.position = "none",
        legend.justification = "left",
        legend.box.spacing = unit(0, "pt"),
        legend.box.margin = margin(0,0,0,0),
        legend.title = element_blank()) +
  guides(fill = guide_legend(nrow = 1)) +
  xlab("DOY (2006)") +
  ylab("Normalized size of bins")
#+END_SRC

** Year 2007
Let's make an analysis of the year of 2007
*** Dataset overview
Startup...
#+BEGIN_SRC R :session tky-overview :results output :exports both
suppressMessages(library(tidyverse))
options(crayon.enabled = FALSE)
#+END_SRC

#+RESULTS:

Now let's read the images we have into a tibble
#+BEGIN_SRC R :session tky-overview :results output :exports both
df.images <- tibble(Picture.Filename=list.files(c("/Volumes/ExtensionHD/PEN/tky-2007-y18_d-imported"), recursive=TRUE, pattern="jpg", full.names=TRUE)) %>%
  separate(Picture.Filename, sep='/', into=c('A', 'B', 'C', 'Dir', 'Subdir', 'Filename'), remove=FALSE) %>%
  select(-A, -B, -C, -Dir, -Subdir) %>%
  mutate(Filename = gsub('.jpg', '', Filename)) %>%
  mutate(Filename = gsub('dc_', '', Filename)) %>%
  separate(Filename, sep='__', into=c('Filename', 'Camera_ID')) %>%
  separate(Filename, sep='_', into=c('Year', 'Day', 'Time', 'Dataset')) %>%
  mutate(Time = gsub('\\+.*', '', Time)) %>%
  mutate(Hour = as.integer(substr(Time, 1, 2))) %>%
  mutate(Minute = as.integer(substr(Time, 3, 4))) %>%
  mutate(Year = as.integer(Year)) %>%
  mutate(Day = as.integer(Day)) %>%
  select(-Time)
df.images
#+END_SRC

#+begin_src R :session tky-2007-hsv-h :results output :exports both
gethist <- function(df, vGrain=10) {
    mask <- df %>% slice(1) %>% pull(Mask.Filename);
    phenovis_read_mask(mask);
    phenovis_get_HSV_double_histogram(phenovis_H(), df %>% pull(Picture.Filename), vGrain) %>%
        filter(H != 0) %>%
        as_tibble()
}

df.histograms <- df.joined %>%
  do(gethist(.)) %>%
  rename(H.count = Count) %>%
  # V histogram is spread, let's gather it
  gather(V, V.count, -Name, -Width, -Height, -Pixels, -H, -H.count) %>%
  # Remove the V, convert to integer
  mutate(V = as.integer(gsub("V", "", V))) %>%
  # Map to [0,1], convert to double
  mutate(V = as.numeric(round(V/9, 2))) %>%
  # Cosmetics
  separate(Name, sep='/', into=c('A', 'B', 'C', 'Dir', 'Subdir', 'Filename'), remove=FALSE) %>%
  select(-A, -B, -C, -Dir, -Subdir) %>%
  mutate(Filename = gsub('.jpg', '', Filename)) %>%
  mutate(Filename = gsub('dc_', '', Filename)) %>%
  separate(Filename, sep='__', into=c('Filename', 'Camera_ID')) %>%
  separate(Filename, sep='_', into=c('Year', 'Day', 'Time', 'Dataset')) %>%
  mutate(Time = gsub('\\+.*', '', Time)) %>%
  mutate(Hour = as.integer(substr(Time, 1, 2))) %>%
  mutate(Minute = as.integer(substr(Time, 3, 4))) %>%
  mutate(Year = as.integer(Year)) %>%
  mutate(Day = as.integer(Day)) %>%
  select(-Time)
df.histograms
#+end_src

palette <- expand.grid(
    H = seq(0, 359),
    S = 1,

          legend.title = element_blank()) +

Now let's calculate the mean histogram using =phenovisr=

#+begin_src R :session tky-2007-hsv-mode :results output :exports both
gethist <- function(df, vGrain=10) {
    mask <- df %>% slice(1) %>% pull(Mask.Filename);
    phenovis_read_mask(mask);
    phenovis_get_HSV_mode_histogram(df %>% pull(Picture.Filename)) %>%
        filter(H != 0) %>%
        as_tibble()
}

df.histograms <- df.joined %>%
  do(gethist(.)) %>%
  # Cosmetics
  separate(Name, sep='/', into=c('A', 'B', 'C', 'Dir', 'Subdir', 'Filename'), remove=FALSE) %>%
  select(-A, -B, -C, -Dir, -Subdir) %>%
  mutate(Filename = gsub('.jpg', '', Filename)) %>%
  mutate(Filename = gsub('dc_', '', Filename)) %>%
  separate(Filename, sep='__', into=c('Filename', 'Camera_ID')) %>%
  separate(Filename, sep='_', into=c('Year', 'Day', 'Time', 'Dataset')) %>%
  mutate(Time = gsub('\\+.*', '', Time)) %>%
  mutate(Hour = as.integer(substr(Time, 1, 2))) %>%
  mutate(Minute = as.integer(substr(Time, 3, 4))) %>%
  mutate(Year = as.integer(Year)) %>%
  mutate(Day = as.integer(Day)) %>%
  select(-Time)
df.histograms
#+end_src

#+begin_src R :session tky-2007-hsv-mode :results output graphics :file img/tky-2007-hsv-mode.png :exports both :width 1400 :height 800
df.palette <- df.histograms %>%
    mutate(Color = hex(HSV(H, SMode, VMode))) %>%
    mutate(Code = as.character(Color)) %>%
    select(Color, Code)

names(palette.list) <- df.palette$Code

df.histograms  %>%
    mutate(Color = as.character(hex(HSV(H, SMode, VMode)))) %>%
    ggplot(aes(x = Day, y = HCount/UnmaskedPixels, fill=as.factor(Color))) +
    scale_fill_manual(values = palette.list) +
    geom_bar(stat='identity') +
    theme_bw(base_size=16) +
    theme(plot.margin = unit(c(0,0,0,0), "cm"),
          legend.spacing = unit(0, "mm"),
          panel.grid = element_blank(),
          legend.position = "none",
          legend.justification = "left",
          legend.box.spacing = unit(0, "pt"),
          legend.box.margin = margin(0,0,0,0),
          legend.title = element_blank()) +
    guides(fill = guide_legend(nrow = 1)) +
    xlab("DOY(2007)") +
    ylab("Normalized size of bins")

And now let's plot it.
#+BEGIN_SRC R :session tky-2007-gcc-mean :results output graphics :file img/tky-2007-gcc-mean.png :exports both :width 1400 :height 800

df.palette <- df.histograms %>%
  mutate(Color = hex(RGB(Bin_color_r, Bin_color_g, Bin_color_b))) %>%
  mutate(Code = as.character(Color)) %>%
  select(Color, Code)

palette.list <- as.character(df.palette$Color)
names(palette.list) <- df.palette$Code

df.histograms  %>%
  filter(Bin_value != 0) %>%
  mutate(Color = as.character(hex(RGB(Bin_color_r, Bin_color_g, Bin_color_b)))) %>%
  ggplot(aes(x = Day, y = Bin_value/Pixels, fill=as.factor(Color))) +
  scale_fill_manual(values = palette.list) +
  geom_bar(stat='identity') +
  theme_bw(base_size=16) +
  theme(#axis.ticks = element_blank(),
        #axis.text = element_blank(),
        plot.margin = unit(c(0,0,0,0), "cm"),
        legend.spacing = unit(0, "mm"),
        panel.grid = element_blank(),
        legend.position = "none",
        legend.justification = "left",
        legend.box.spacing = unit(0, "pt"),
        legend.box.margin = margin(0,0,0,0),
        legend.title = element_blank()) +
  guides(fill = guide_legend(nrow = 1)) +
  xlab("DOY (2007)") +
  ylab("Normalized size of bins")
#+END_SRC

*** Dataset overview
Startup...
#+BEGIN_SRC R :session tky-overview :results output :exports both
suppressMessages(library(tidyverse))
options(crayon.enabled = FALSE)
#+END_SRC

#+RESULTS:

Now let's read the images we have into a tibble
#+BEGIN_SRC R :session tky-overview :results output :exports both
df.images <- tibble(Picture.Filename=list.files(c("/Volumes/ExtensionHD/PEN/tky-2008-y18_d-imported"), recursive=TRUE, pattern="jpg", full.names=TRUE)) %>%
  separate(Picture.Filename, sep='/', into=c('A', 'B', 'C', 'Dir', 'Subdir', 'Filename'), remove=FALSE) %>%
  select(-A, -B, -C, -Dir, -Subdir) %>%
  mutate(Filename = gsub('.jpg', '', Filename)) %>%
  mutate(Filename = gsub('dc_', '', Filename)) %>%
  separate(Filename, sep='__', into=c('Filename', 'Camera_ID')) %>%
  separate(Filename, sep='_', into=c('Year', 'Day', 'Time', 'Dataset')) %>%
  mutate(Time = gsub('\\+.*', '', Time)) %>%
  mutate(Hour = as.integer(substr(Time, 1, 2))) %>%
  mutate(Minute = as.integer(substr(Time, 3, 4))) %>%
  mutate(Year = as.integer(Year)) %>%
  mutate(Day = as.integer(Day)) %>%
  select(-Time)
df.images
#+END_SRC

#+begin_src R :session tky-2008-hsv-h :results output :exports both
gethist <- function(df, vGrain=10) {
    mask <- df %>% slice(1) %>% pull(Mask.Filename);
    phenovis_read_mask(mask);
    phenovis_get_HSV_double_histogram(phenovis_H(), df %>% pull(Picture.Filename), vGrain) %>%
        filter(H != 0) %>%
        as_tibble()
}

df.histograms <- df.joined %>%
  do(gethist(.)) %>%
  rename(H.count = Count) %>%
  # V histogram is spread, let's gather it
  gather(V, V.count, -Name, -Width, -Height, -Pixels, -H, -H.count) %>%
  # Remove the V, convert to integer
  mutate(V = as.integer(gsub("V", "", V))) %>%
  # Map to [0,1], convert to double
  mutate(V = as.numeric(round(V/9, 2))) %>%
  # Cosmetics
  separate(Name, sep='/', into=c('A', 'B', 'C', 'Dir', 'Subdir', 'Filename'), remove=FALSE) %>%
  select(-A, -B, -C, -Dir, -Subdir) %>%
  mutate(Filename = gsub('.jpg', '', Filename)) %>%
  mutate(Filename = gsub('dc_', '', Filename)) %>%
  separate(Filename, sep='__', into=c('Filename', 'Camera_ID')) %>%
  separate(Filename, sep='_', into=c('Year', 'Day', 'Time', 'Dataset')) %>%
  mutate(Time = gsub('\\+.*', '', Time)) %>%
  mutate(Hour = as.integer(substr(Time, 1, 2))) %>%
  mutate(Minute = as.integer(substr(Time, 3, 4))) %>%
  mutate(Year = as.integer(Year)) %>%
  mutate(Day = as.integer(Day)) %>%
  select(-Time)
df.histograms
#+end_src

palette <- expand.grid(
    H = seq(0, 359),
    S = 1,
    V = 1) %>%
    # The color code
    mutate(Color.Code = as.factor(H)) %>%
    # The color itself
    mutate(Color = hex(HSV(H, S, V))) %>%
    as_tibble

names(palette.list) <- palette$Color.Code

df.pure.hsv %>%
    mutate(Color.Code = H) %>%    
    ggplot(aes(x = Day, y = H.count/Pixels, fill=as.factor(Color.Code))) +
    scale_fill_manual(values = palette.list) +
    geom_bar(stat='identity') +
    theme_bw(base_size=16) +
    theme(plot.margin = unit(c(0,0,0,0), "cm"),
          legend.spacing = unit(0, "mm"),
          panel.grid = element_blank(),
          legend.position = "none",
          legend.justification = "left",
          legend.box.spacing = unit(0, "pt"),
          legend.box.margin = margin(0,0,0,0),
          legend.title = element_blank()) +
    guides(fill = guide_legend(nrow = 1)) +
    xlab("DOY (2008)") +

#+BEGIN_SRC R :session tky-2008-gcc-mean :results output graphics :file img/tky-2008-gcc-mean.png :exports both :width 1400 :height 800

df.palette <- df.histograms %>%
  mutate(Color = hex(RGB(Bin_color_r, Bin_color_g, Bin_color_b))) %>%
  mutate(Code = as.character(Color)) %>%
  select(Color, Code)

palette.list <- as.character(df.palette$Color)
names(palette.list) <- df.palette$Code

df.histograms  %>%
  filter(Bin_value != 0) %>%
  mutate(Color = as.character(hex(RGB(Bin_color_r, Bin_color_g, Bin_color_b)))) %>%

#+begin_src R :session tky-2009-hsv-h :results output :exports both
gethist <- function(df, vGrain=10) {
    mask <- df %>% slice(1) %>% pull(Mask.Filename);
    phenovis_read_mask(mask);
    phenovis_get_HSV_double_histogram(phenovis_H(), df %>% pull(Picture.Filename), vGrain) %>%
        filter(H != 0) %>%
        as_tibble()
}

df.histograms <- df.joined %>%
  do(gethist(.)) %>%
  rename(H.count = Count) %>%
  # V histogram is spread, let's gather it
  gather(V, V.count, -Name, -Width, -Height, -Pixels, -H, -H.count) %>%
  # Remove the V, convert to integer
  mutate(V = as.integer(gsub("V", "", V))) %>%
  # Map to [0,1], convert to double
  mutate(V = as.numeric(round(V/9, 2))) %>%
  # Cosmetics
  separate(Name, sep='/', into=c('A', 'B', 'C', 'Dir', 'Subdir', 'Filename'), remove=FALSE) %>%
  select(-A, -B, -C, -Dir, -Subdir) %>%
  mutate(Filename = gsub('.jpg', '', Filename)) %>%
  mutate(Filename = gsub('dc_', '', Filename)) %>%
  separate(Filename, sep='__', into=c('Filename', 'Camera_ID')) %>%
  separate(Filename, sep='_', into=c('Year', 'Day', 'Time', 'Dataset')) %>%
  mutate(Time = gsub('\\+.*', '', Time)) %>%
  mutate(Hour = as.integer(substr(Time, 1, 2))) %>%
  mutate(Minute = as.integer(substr(Time, 3, 4))) %>%
  mutate(Year = as.integer(Year)) %>%
  mutate(Day = as.integer(Day)) %>%
  select(-Time)
df.histograms

#+begin_src R :session tky-2010-hsv-h :results output :exports both
gethist <- function(df, vGrain=10) {
    mask <- df %>% slice(1) %>% pull(Mask.Filename);
    phenovis_read_mask(mask);
    phenovis_get_HSV_double_histogram(phenovis_H(), df %>% pull(Picture.Filename), vGrain) %>%
        filter(H != 0) %>%
        as_tibble()
}

df.histograms <- df.joined %>%
  do(gethist(.)) %>%
  rename(H.count = Count) %>%
  # V histogram is spread, let's gather it
  gather(V, V.count, -Name, -Width, -Height, -Pixels, -H, -H.count) %>%
  # Remove the V, convert to integer
  mutate(V = as.integer(gsub("V", "", V))) %>%
  # Map to [0,1], convert to double
  mutate(V = as.numeric(round(V/9, 2))) %>%
  # Cosmetics
  separate(Name, sep='/', into=c('A', 'B', 'C', 'Dir', 'Subdir', 'Filename'), remove=FALSE) %>%
  select(-A, -B, -C, -Dir, -Subdir) %>%
  mutate(Filename = gsub('.jpg', '', Filename)) %>%
  mutate(Filename = gsub('dc_', '', Filename)) %>%
  separate(Filename, sep='__', into=c('Filename', 'Camera_ID')) %>%
  separate(Filename, sep='_', into=c('Year', 'Day', 'Time', 'Dataset')) %>%
  mutate(Time = gsub('\\+.*', '', Time)) %>%
  mutate(Hour = as.integer(substr(Time, 1, 2))) %>%
  mutate(Minute = as.integer(substr(Time, 3, 4))) %>%
  mutate(Year = as.integer(Year)) %>%
  mutate(Day = as.integer(Day)) %>%
  select(-Time)
df.histograms
#+end_src

  mutate(Year = as.integer(Year)) %>%
